content.description: Slightly chossy jugs lead left to a ledge shared with Double Clutch. A short but difficult sequence heads out the left side of the roof and onto the arete. Fun moves on the arete and face get to the anchor.
content.location: Left most route on this panel.

content.description: Climb easy fifth class to a ledge. Pull a few tricky moves getting established over the first bulge. Pull up into the next bulge and use fantastic edges to get to a good stance on the slab. Climb directly up to the steepening roof to powerful crux moves right before the anchor.
content.location: On the ledge left of Lucky Boy.

content.description: Follow the bolts to a crux in a right facing corner.
content.protection: Bolts to anchor and chains. Be careful on the lower or rap as a 60m barely reaches the largest ledge.
content.location: Start up easy 5th class climbing in the middle of the scoop to gain a ledge. Follow bolts to the beautiful black corner, execute the static cling crux, and finish on big holds.

content.description: Steep jugs for three bolts gets you to a fun crux section, then over a little bulge and a few more moves to the chains. Kind of a squeeze job but pretty good climbing.
content.location: Start up Not Tobie and continue straight at the second bolt where Not Tobie goes right.

content.description: Face climbing to the right side of the roof leads to a bulge and then some pumpy layback and crack moves get to a rest before a final push to the anchor.
content.location: To the right of Double Clutch

content.description: Climb a little choss to a corner and then make bouldery moves to get established at a good stance. Climb up to the small roof and figure out the crux mantle over it. Pull over a hollow block and follow perfect crimps to the anchor.
content.location: First route in the middle area, up to steep corner, right of Rona’s.

content.description: Moderate face climbing.
content.location: Start a little right and uphill of Double Clutch.

content.description: Start up Christina’s Roof but clip a bolt on the right side. Head right under the roof on good crimps and get established at a no hands rest in the dihedral. Big holds then take you straight out the top roof to a hero finish at a ledge.
content.location: Start on Christina’s Roof but head right on grey limestone-like rock.

content.description: Climb choss on the right side of the little cave, then head left under the roof and pull up into the same dihedral as Rona’s Ruse. At the top of the dihedral, bust powerful, crux moves up and right through the steepest part of the upper roof.
content.location: Right side of small cave shared with Rona’s Ruse.

content.description: Steep, bouldery climbing past three bolts leads to the dihedral. Stem up the dihedral to cruxy exit moves near the last bolt.
content.location: Right side of cave with fixed draw

content.description: A couple bolts up easy fifth class slab lead to a ledge. Face climb to the roof and unlock crux number one getting established at a good stance. Fun, juggy holds lead to the second crux and an airy finish.
content.location: Follow two bolts on the left side of the slab to gain the ledge and up the face to the roof.

content.description: Use bolts for Static Cling or Rim Walk to gain the ledge. Climb juggy holds to a stance on the arete. Fun moves lead up the beautiful face to an airy jug and then the ledge.
content.location: To the right of Rim Walk, up the corner and arete to the beautiful gold and black face.

content.description: Start up Tobie direct and at the second bolt head right along the roof and bust hard moves getting established on the face. Pumpy climbing leads to the ledge on Tobie for a good shake before heading out right to another crux getting to the anchor (although a little contrived, skipping the ledge on Tobie and continuing straight up into the final crux makes for a much greater pump).
content.location: To the right of Tobie Direct, out the blocky roof.

content.description: Best, most aesthetic, route at the crag on neat zebra streaked stone. Tobie, the direct start, adds about 1 pump point. This fine route begins with easier climbing on slightly overhanging terrain, trending right, into some tricky corner funk, to a few powerful moves concluding with some fun moves to the anchor.
content.location: Left side of the cave

content.description: Face climb lower angle grey rock trending to the left of the black roof. Pull the bulge using fun holds and continue up on featured black rock to the anchor.
content.location: Start on grey rock to the left of Christina’s Roof.

content.description: Climb the crack, the crux, then up and left to an anchor on a ledge.
content.protection: Mixed gear and bolts.  Shares an anchor with Access Card
content.location: Crack on the right side of the first ledge system.

content.description: There is a big story about about this climb (7 September 2002).  The name says it all...
content.location: Uphill and right of Fall Guy.  On the upper section of the climb, the route passes a couple of roofs on the right.

content.description: Fun face climbing but trend right at the finish.
content.location: Route just right of Rosie Wants Me Home.

content.description: Follow two bolts up easy fifth class slab to a ledge. Pull over the little roof, navigate the bush, and pull over the crux roof to an enormous jug.  Moderate climbing leads to the anchor.
content.location: Starts on easy fifth class from the ledge out left of Lucky Boy.

content.description: Climb dirty ledges to the black face. Crux moves get you established on the face and then traverse right on jugs. Pull a little bulge and climb easy slab to the base of the final headwall. A tricky move leads to positive, fun climbing to the chains.
content.protection: 11 bolts. A sling or two will help rope drag.
content.location: The far side.

content.description: Easier climbing leads to a move over a little bulge and to the base of a short steep face. Fun holds past a few bolts leads to cruxy moves getting on the ledge. Climb up the steep corner and make tricky moves getting established on the slab. Finish with a little face climbing on the final head wall to the airy anchor.
content.location: Scramble up easy fifth class to the first bolt left of Fall Boy.

content.description: Great route. The easiest one at the crag. long and a bit exposed. Best part is the view gets better the higher you get.
content.location: Start on easy 5th class in the right side of the scoop and follow bolt line angling left.

content.description: Bottom a little gritty but super moves at the roof.
content.protection: Bolts to an anchor and chains.
content.location: The leftmost route on the upper tier.  Find the roof with bolts.

content.description: Face climbing to finesse moves to mount the roof.
content.location: Just right of two 5.12 routes, find the darker roof.

content.description: Fun warmup on big holds. Better than it looks.
content.location: To the left of Rosie.

content.description: Face climb initially then up and left to the anchor.  The climb provides access to additional climbs to the left if TRs are desired.
content.location: The rightmost climb at the Rim.  Shares an anchor with Miguel's Warmup.

content.description: This south-west facing crag is the best of pecos. Its has the best view of the high peaks, and you'll probably never see another climber there. In the summer, it gets shade till about 2. It hosts the longest routes in pecos and of the best quality in pecos.
